content.description:
This climb is located on the west side of the main prow starting just right of an obvious crack system.

Climb up the beautifully crystallized face to the top out.  Technical crystal climbing that is sure to challenge!!

Exit the wall by walking north and down climbing some easy slabs.
content.location: From the 1st parking lot take the Sisters trail until it meets up with the Ponderosa.  Take a left (west) for about 50 yards and look up to your right and you will see this tall steep wall called the "Wisdom Wall" about 100 or so yards up hill.  Once you have got it spotted just keep your eye on it and continue to follow the Ponderosa Trail until in joins up with the "Brothers Lookout" Trail.  Follow the Brothers trail for about 50 yards before taking a right or heading back EAST thought the bush towards the 1st Tier of the Brothers formation.  Continue EASTING until you run into this unmistakable corner/prow/arete feature.  You will know it when you see it!!!  Enjoy!!

content.description:
Climb the obvious steep crack and face just to the right of "Crystal Corner."

A good line that could get even better with some more traffic.  It's still quite dirty or I would have given it three stars for sure.  Worth the time to climb!!!

Exit by climbing left around the upper block to the easy slabs that you are to down climb.
content.location: From the 1st parking lot take the Sisters trail until it meets up with the Ponderosa. content.description:
Climb the face just right of "

Reverse Transit

" via thin face crimps and a vertical thin seam.  Could be pretty hard!?!?  Maybe V7-V9?  We will see soon enough!!  Looks cool!!

content.description:
Climb the arete/corner on the far right side of the "Harbored Wall."  A good line that also just needs a touch more traffic and some cleaning.  A great line that is a little hairy at the top.

Exit by traversing left all the way around the upper block to the back side down climb slabs.
content.location: From the 1st parking lot take the Sisters trail until it meets up with the Ponderosa.  Take a left (west) for about 50 yards and look up to your right and you will see this tall steep wall called the "Wisdom Wall" about 100 or so yards up hill. content.description:
The start is the same for the "

Crystal Corner (LEFT)

."

The (RIGHT) version continues out right over exposed space following a small seam and sires of face holds.  This version of the "Crystal Corner" is a little harder and more heady and the fall from the upper slab could be very bad.  But a great line for sure.  It's the jewel of the wall!!  It's a must climb!!
content.protection: Pads and a spot!!  Possible bad landing on this one!!
content.location: From the 1st parking lot take the Sisters trail until it meets up with the Ponderosa.  Take a left (west) for about 50 yards and look up to your right and you will see this tall steep wall called the "Wisdom Wall" about 100 or so yards up hill. content.description:
Start on the obvious corner with a huge flat jug.  Climb up and reach high with your right for a small crystal.  Move into a sloping pocket with your left.  Next, for the LEFT EXIT, progress left to a huge crystal ball.  Once the hold is gained continue up the slab to the top out.

Exit by walking NORTH to down climb some easy slabs.

This line is much harder that it looks!!! Have fun!!
